long_description:
The most mushy day of the year is upon us. Whether you believe in its romantic roots or you’re adamant that this is a plot by card-making companies to take over the world, the days preceding Valentine’s Day are hectic. And in a city like New York, V-Day tends to be on steroids - whether that’s good or not, it’s up to you.

 

Valentine’s Day in the Big Apple means Love in Times Square - a massive event that attracts all sorts of lovey-dovey people from around the globe who want to get married, plan a surprise proposal or renew their vows. Head to Central Park and you’ll find couples hidden around every corner - more than you’ll ever see in a high school homecoming dance!

 

No matter what your stance on February 14 is, the truth is that there’s no better time of year to snag a few 2x1 deals, savor special dinners, grab a few cheeky cocktails or attend a themed event. Sure, join the masses celebrating love and friendship as if it was the 60s and Summer of Love, but eventually you’ll welcome a sophisticated retreat. And that’s where Royalton New York Hotel comes in.

 

 

Join us on Valentine’s Day for a special a la carte menu at our staple Forty Four Restaurant. We’ve selected a balanced choice of soups, salads, entrées desserts - vegetarians are welcome! Our sommelier has carefully curated a wine selection to go with your meal - get your taste buds ready for an invigorating experience.

 

Once you’re ready for a digestif or two, Bar 44 is where you want to be. We’re known by the locals as a top spot with a casual elegant atmosphere and mouth-watering signature cocktails. If you’ve booked a room at the hotel, be sure to ask our staff to light up a fireplace for you. When the weather is under 45°F, our wood-burning fireplaces alone make your stay at Royalton New York unique.

 

Whether you’re after a romantic getaway or merely an evening with great food and drinks, the Royalton-and-New York City combo are sure to impress.
